required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo IGF-1R Molecular Imaging Using [68Ga]- Labelling Anti-IGF-1R Affibody Molecule
clinical_study.official_title: Targeted Molecular Imaging of [68Ga]- Labelling Anti-IGF-1R Affibody Molecule in IGF-1R Overexpression Cancer Patients （Such as Colon Cancer、NSCLC and Gliomas）and Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators developed [68Ga]-labelling Anti-IGF-1R Affibody Molecule as a targeted molecular imaging agent for noninvasive and repeatable detecting IGF-1R expression status.

detailed_description.textblock: The goals of investigators are to evaluate the use of [68Ga]-labelling Anti-IGF-1R Affibody Molecule as a novel PET/CT radiotracer to monitor IGF-1R expression status. The investigators want to evaluate the use of [68Ga]-labelling Anti-IGF-1R Affibody Molecule in IGF-1R expression cancer imaging in adult cancer patients （colon cancer 、NSCLC、gliomas cancer patients）with different IGF-1R expression status.

primary_outcome.measure: tumor SUV value of 68Ga-NODAGA-ZIGF-1R:4:40 PET/CT Imaging
primary_outcome.description: To quantify the accumulation, a volume of interest using a 3D sphere, was placed over the tumor, lymph nodes and distant metastases avoiding necrosis, blood vessels and normal tissues as much as possible on a workstation (Advantage Workstation 4.6; GE Healthcare). The maximum standard uptake value (SUVmax) normalized to body weight (kBq/mL) was calculated within the region of interest.

arm_group.description: Patients in this group had IGF-1R overexpression tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients in this group had IGF-1R moderate expression tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients in this group had IGF-1R low expression tumors and did not receive any treatment before this study.
Patients in this group who are healthy volunteer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Colon cancer, NSCLC and gliomas patients with pathological and gene detection results and did not receive any treatment
2. More than 18 years old
3. A life expectancy of at least 12 weeks
4. Presence of a malignant lesion within the chest of at least 0.5 cm diameter as measured by computed tomography (CT)
5. Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Could not get pathological and gene detection results
2. Pregnancy
3. do not want to write informed consent。

overall_official.affiliation: The Fourth Hospital of Harbin Medical University
